page.title: 08Railway at Cromwell
page.content: Through this quiet rural area runs the busy{railway line}from{Scotland to {London, King's Cross.}The line has a great effect on people's lives in the area as the main road to Newark from Norwell crosses the line at{Cromwell and regular travellers along the road are frequently held up at the crossing. As trains can travel over this crossing at speeds of over{100 {m.p.h.}the delay on the barriers has to be sufficient to ensure adequate safety. We decided to do a survey at the crossing to see just how long the barriers stayed down. On Wednesday October 23rd between 1330 and 1430, 5 trains passed the crossing, all{Inter {City 125's.}We timed the barriers..... Barriers up, road open...44.17 mins. Barriers down............15.43 mins. The road was closed{25%}of the time.
